subject: ACCESS BANK CREDIT CARDS
body:
ACCESS BANK CREDIT CARDS
The access bank has agreed  to pay your interest payment  of 1.5m US
Dollars from WHO USAID compensation scheme,  assigned to you as
beneficiary.  The bank will make this payment only through ATM card,
please go through this ATM process and get back to us with your full
details.  This payment is scheduled  to pay on or before December 20th
latest.
The Access Bank Credit Visa card is a dual-currency denominatedpayment
card which allows you spend and settle in naira for
 domestic transactions while all your international transactions are
billed and settled in US dollars
Access Bank offers a bouquet of card products for individual and
corporate customers under the major card schemes – Visa, MasterCard,
and Verve. Our electronic payment cards are available in the following
variants:
 Credit Cards – VISA
Debit Cards – VISA, Verve, MasterCard
 Prepaid Cards – VISA, Verve, MasterCard
US Dollars denominated card.Accepted at 2 million ATMs and 30 million
merchant locations, across over 220 countries globally. Interest free
period of up to 40 days. Minimum monthly repayment of 15% of
outstanding balance
Available in Gold, Platinum and Infinite variants.
Verified By Visa (VbyV) additional security for online transactions
Pay for domestic spends in Naira and international spends in US Dollar
Supplementary cards available
Card limit per variant:
Classic - 0 to $10,000
Gold - $10,001 to $20,000
Platinum - $20,001 to $50,000
Collect your card, pin and VbyV pin from the account officer .
Chat our contact centre on 0902 for cardholder authentication and card
activation.
Note that some of the information provided by you during the
application process will be required during the activation process.
Your Credit card is accepted in over 30 million merchant locations, 2
million ATMs in 220 countries.
Thanks
Peter

subject: Re: ACCESS BANK CREDIT CARDS
body:
Dear Peter,

Thank you for your email regarding the Access Bank Credit Visa card. I am interested in this offer and would like to proceed with the application process.

Best wishes,
Jamie
